intro: Gladiolus horombensis, commonly known as the Horombensis gladiolus, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of Madagascar. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, often brightly colored floral structures. The plant typically features tall, erect stems with narrow, sword-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually arranged in dense spikes and can display a variety of hues, including red, orange, and yellow. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanically significant and potentially endangered species.
